definition: the New World/the Americas as opposed to the Old World 舊大陸|旧大陆[jiu4 da4 lu4] or Eurasia
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: They hoped to obtain exit visas here and escaped to the New World At first, Rick can't forgive that Ilsa's gone back on[3] her word.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望能在这里得到出境证后逃离到美洲新大陆去。

sentences.english: Each settlement of the Pilgrims was a little piece of the Old World inserted into the New.
sentences.chinese: 每一处清教徒的居留地，都是嵌进新大陆的旧世界。

sentences.english: People used to give credit Columbus for the discovery of the New Continent.
sentences.chinese: 人们过去把发现新大陆的功劳归之于哥伦布。

sentences.english: The feeling was that this was new territory.
sentences.chinese: 给人感觉像是看到了一片新大陆。

sentences.english: New World curlew that breeds in northern North America.
sentences.chinese: 在北美洲北部繁殖的新大陆杓鹬。

sentences.english: EXPLORE】Columbus discovered America but did not explore the new continent.
sentences.chinese: 哥伦布发现美洲，可是并没有到那块新大陆上去探险。

sentences.english: Columbus discovered America , but did not explore the new continent.
sentences.chinese: 哥伦布发现了美洲，但未探勘此新大陆。

sentences.english: Many of the old puritan colonist retain their factious temperament in the new world.
sentences.chinese: 许多清教徒开拓者在新大陆仍保持他们好争论的脾气。

sentences.english: Columbus was the man who was attributed to having discovered America.
sentences.chinese: 哥伦布被认为发现了美洲新大陆。

sentences.english: Ghost faced bats are widely spread in the New World, from the southern US to Peru.
sentences.chinese: 鬼脸蝠广泛分布在从美国南部到秘鲁的新大陆中。

sentences.english: The life expectancy of these hardy settlers upon arriving was two years.
sentences.chinese: 这些饱尝磨难的拓居者到达新大陆后的寿命只有两年。

sentences.english: New World migratory locusts and common American grasshoppers.
sentences.chinese: 新大陆的移栖的蝗虫和常见的美洲蚱蜢。

sentences.english: Getting “screeched in” on George Street in St. Johns, Newfoundland.
sentences.chinese: 新大陆圣约翰的乔治大街上充满了尖叫声。

sentences.english: You send one after another sea expedition in which discover new lands.
sentences.chinese: 故你派出了一队又一队海洋探险人员去发现新大陆。

sentences.english: We still call the copper-colored natives of the New World Indians.
sentences.chinese: 我们仍把新大陆古铜色皮肤的土著称作印度人。

sentences.english: They achieved this long before Columbus ever set sail.
sentences.chinese: 这就是哥伦布发现新大陆航行的海道。

definition: Cristóbal Colón or Christopher Columbus (1451-1506)/Columbus, capital of Ohio
the Old World/Eurasia as opposed to the New World 新大陸|新大陆[xin1 da4 lu4] or the Americas
the Americas/North and South American continents
America (including North, Central and South America)/the Americas/abbr. for 亞美利加洲|亚美利加洲[Ya4 mei3 li4 jia1 Zhou1]
Captain James Cook (1728-1779), British navigator and explorer
the West (Europe and North America)/countries of the Indian Ocean (traditional)
